entries.title: The Papers: Harry wants family 'back' and NHS on 'knife edge'
entries.description: The Duke of Sussex's calls to reconcile with his father and brother leads Tuesday's front pages.

entries.title: Tuesday's transfer gossip: Ronaldo, Badiashile, Nunes, Bellingham, Felix, Mudryk
entries.description: Cristiano Ronaldo's contract has Newcastle clause, Benoit Badiashile set for Chelsea medical, Liverpool target Matheus Nunes, plus more.

entries.title: Earth, Wind & Fire drummer Fred White dies aged 67
entries.description: Child drumming prodigy White was one of the early members of the band with several of his brothers.

entries.title: PDC World Championship: Michael van Gerwen to play Michael Smith in 2023 final
entries.description: Michael van Gerwen and Michael Smith will contest the PDC World Darts Championship final after semi-final wins on Monday.

entries.title: Queens Park Rangers 1-1 Sheffield United: John Egan's late goal salvages point for Blades
entries.description: John Egan's last-ditch goal salvages a point for second-placed Sheffield United at a spirited Queens Park Rangers.

entries.title: Times Square: Teenager charged over New York NYE machete attack
entries.description: Trevor Bickford is accused of attacking three officers near Times Square during new year celebrations.

entries.title: Masters: Invite sent to US golfer Scott Stallings' namesake
entries.description: US golfer Scott Stallings is handed a shock after discovering his Masters invitation has been sent to another person of the same name.

entries.title: England: Matt Proudfoot leaves forwards coach role after Eddie Jones exit
entries.description: Matt Proudfoot leaves his role as England forwards coach less than a month after Eddie Jones' departure as head coach.

entries.title: Russia plans to 'exhaust' Ukraine with prolonged attacks - Zelensky
entries.description: Ukraine's president says Moscow aims to exhaust his country with a prolonged wave of drone strikes.

entries.title: Brentford 3-1 Liverpool: Reds boss Jurgen Klopp 'not happy' with display
entries.description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says he is "not happy" with his side's performance in the 3-1 loss against Brentford at the Community Stadium.

entries.title: Brentford 3-1 Liverpool: Bees punish Reds' sloppy first-half performance
entries.description: Liverpool miss the chance to edge closer to the Premier League top four as Brentford punish their defensive frailties in a deserved victory at the Community Stadium.

entries.title: Ancient Egyptian 'Green Coffin' returned to Cairo by US
entries.description: The brightly painted wooden sarcophagus was smuggled to the US by a global art trafficking network.

entries.title: Rangers 2-2 Celtic: Beale and Postecoglou on Old Firm game
entries.description: The second Old Firm game of the season ended with managers Michael Beale and Ange Postecoglou pleased with their sides' performance.

entries.title: Train strikes: People returning to work face more strikes
entries.description: Only 20% of services are expected to run this week due to walkouts by RMT and Aslef union members.

entries.title: Senegal MPs jailed for kicking pregnant colleague Amy Ndiaye
entries.description: The two male lawmakers attacked Amy Ndiaye after she criticised an opposition religious figure.

entries.title: Children told to stay home from school if sick amid flu, Covid and scarlet fever
entries.description: The advice to parents at the end of the Christmas break comes amid high levels of flu and Covid cases.

entries.title: Swansea City 1-2 Burnley: Ian Maatsen double seals leaders' sixth straight win
entries.description: Leaders Burnley claim a sixth straight Championship victory as Ian Maatsen's spectacular first-half double secures a 2-1 win at Swansea City.

entries.title: More MEPs could lose immunity in corruption probe, president says
entries.description: EU parliament bids to lift immunity of two more MEPs in Qatar-linked corruption investigation.

entries.title: Match of the Day 2 analysis: How Aston Villa dominated Tottenham Hotspur in midfield
entries.description: Match of the Day 2 pundits Fara Williams and Matt Upson analyse Aston Villa's tactical choices and dominant midfield performance against Tottenham Hotspur in their 2-0 win on New Year's Day.

entries.title: Martina Navratilova: Tennis legend diagnosed with throat and breast cancer
entries.description: Martina Navratilova reveals she has been diagnosed with both throat and breast cancer.

entries.title: Pele's funeral: Brazil legend lying in state in Santos' stadium
entries.description: Thousands of mourners pay their respects to Brazil legend Pele who is lying in state at the stadium of his former club, Santos.

entries.title: Rangers 2-2 Celtic: Kyogo Furuhashi denies Ibrox side win
entries.description: Kyogo Furuhashi's late equaliser denies Rangers a famous Old Firm comeback victory and preserves Celtic's nine-point lead in the Scottish Premiership.

entries.title: Prince Harry: 'I want my father and brother back'
entries.description: The Duke of Sussex made the comments in an interview ahead of the release of his book.

entries.title: Three people dead in fire at New County Hotel in Perth
entries.description: Guests were evacuated from the New County Hotel after the alarm was raised at about 05:10.

entries.title: Wallasey pub shooting: Sister says Elle Edwards was her soulmate
entries.description: Elle Edwards, 26, was shot on Christmas Eve outside The Lighthouse pub in Wallasey.

entries.title: ASB Classic: Venus Williams starts 30th year on WTA Tour with win over Katie Volynets
entries.description: Venus Williams starts her 30th year on the WTA Tour with a straight-set victory over fellow American Katie Volynets at the ASB Classic in Auckland, New Zealand.

entries.title: Croatia begins new euro and Schengen zone era
entries.description: The country committed to joining the eurozone when it became the EU's newest member in 2013.

entries.title: Jeremy Renner: Avengers star "critical but stable" in hospital after snow plough accident
entries.description: The Marvel actor was airlifted to hospital from his home near Reno, Nevada on Sunday.

entries.title: Pelé: Fireworks greet coffin as Brazil prepares to bid legend farewell
entries.description: Brazilian football legend Pelé's body has been taken to the stadium of his former club Santos.

entries.title: Premier League predictions: Chris Sutton faces Modernlove drummer and Liverpool fan Cian McCluskey
entries.description: Chris Sutton takes on Modernlove drummer and Liverpool fan Cian McCluskey to pick his winners and losers from the midweek Premier League games.

entries.title: Adelaide International: Novak Djokovic receives positive welcome back to Australia
entries.description: Novak Djokovic receives a positive welcome back to Australia as he made a rare doubles appearances at the Adelaide International.

entries.title: Australia helicopter collision: Four dead in mid-air incident over Gold Coast
entries.description: Four people were killed and three, a woman and two young boys, are in critical condition.

entries.title: NFL week 17: Tom Brady makes play-offs with Buccaneers, Giants end post-season drought
entries.description: Tom Brady steers the Tampa Bay Buccaneers to their divisional title and the New York Giants end their play-off drought.

entries.title: OCD: 'I was afraid to talk about it, but you shouldn't be'
entries.description: People in the black community are urging others to speak out about their experience with OCD.

entries.title: Mother-and-baby homes: 'One of the greatest scandals'
entries.description: Children who grew up in mother-and-baby homes urge politicians to press forward with public inquiry.

entries.title: Dozens escape Mexican jail in deadly attack
entries.description: Suspected members of a drug cartel pull up in armoured vehicles and open fire on prison guards.

entries.title: Some A&Es in complete state of crisis, warn health chiefs
entries.description: Hospitals are facing soaring demands and experts say there is "no doubt" it causes harm to patients.

entries.title: Pope Benedict XVI: Lying in state at the Vatican begins
entries.description: Tens of thousands of people are expected to pay their respects to Benedict XVI before his funeral on Thursday.

entries.title: Retail: Last year saw a big jump in the number of shops closing
entries.description: A total of 17,145 shops shut last year across the UK's High Streets, shopping centres and parades.

entries.title: Third of world in recession this year, IMF head warns
entries.description: Kristalina Georgieva said 2023 will be "tougher" than last year as the global economy faces challenges.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: Drone attacks continue on Kyiv and eastern Ukraine
entries.description: Air raid sirens sounded shortly before midnight as the latest in a wave of attacks by Russia over the New Year period began.

entries.title: The Ghanaian giant reported to be the world’s tallest man
entries.description: A hospital told Sulemana he was 9ft 6in, but nurses couldn't be sure - so the BBC went to find out.

entries.title: 'My autism made me an artist but I wanted a family'
entries.description: David Downes, who paints from his photographic memory, says being autistic has shaped his whole life.

entries.title: Sound Of 2023: Cat Burns went from busking to a platinum record
entries.description: The singer, whose single Go went platinum this year, takes fourth place in the BBC Sound Of 2023.
